questions.question: In Arkansas, all passengers must wear seat belts regardless of seating position.
questions.explanation: Arkansas law requires all passengers to wear seat belts in all seating positions.

questions.question: Children under what age and weight must be in an appropriate child restraint system?
questions.explanation: Arkansas law requires children 6 years old and under 60 lbs to be in a child restraint system.

questions.question: You must stop for a school bus with flashing red lights even if you are on the opposite side of a divided highway.
questions.explanation: On a divided highway with a median or barrier, traffic on the opposite side does not need to stop.

questions.question: How far must you stop from a school bus with flashing red lights?
questions.explanation: You must stop at least 10 feet away from a school bus with flashing red lights.

questions.question: Throwing a lit cigarette from a vehicle is not considered littering in Arkansas.
questions.explanation: Throwing any object, including lit cigarettes, from a vehicle is illegal littering in Arkansas.

questions.question: What is the penalty for speeding in a work zone when workers are present?
questions.explanation: Fines are doubled in work zones when workers are present.

questions.question: A flashing yellow traffic light means you must stop and proceed with caution.
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light means slow down and proceed with caution, but you do not need to stop.

questions.question: What should you do when approaching a flashing red traffic light?
options: Treat it as a yield sign
Speed up to clear the intersection
questions.explanation: A flashing red light should be treated like a stop sign - come to a complete stop and proceed when safe.

questions.question: An octagon-shaped sign is always a stop sign.
questions.explanation: The octagon (8-sided) shape is exclusively used for stop signs.

questions.question: What shape is a yield sign?
questions.explanation: Yield signs are triangular with the point facing downward.

questions.question: You may cross a solid yellow line to pass another vehicle.
questions.explanation: A solid yellow line indicates no passing is allowed. You may only pass when there is a broken yellow line on your side.

questions.question: What does a white line separate?
options: Traffic moving in the same direction
questions.explanation: White lines separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.

questions.question: The left lane on a multi-lane highway should be used primarily for passing.
questions.explanation: The left lane is intended for passing slower traffic. Slower traffic should keep right.

questions.question: At a four-way stop, who has the right of way?
questions.explanation: At a four-way stop, the vehicle that arrives first has the right of way. If two vehicles arrive simultaneously, the vehicle on the right has the right of way.

questions.question: When entering a roadway from a driveway, you must yield to all traffic already on the roadway.
questions.explanation: Vehicles entering from driveways, parking lots, or private roads must yield to all traffic on the public roadway.

questions.question: How far from a fire hydrant must you park?
questions.explanation: You must park at least 15 feet away from a fire hydrant.

questions.question: You can park within 30 feet of a stop sign.
questions.explanation: You must not park within 30 feet of a stop sign, traffic signal, or crosswalk.

questions.question: When should you signal before making a turn?
options: Only when other cars are present
questions.explanation: You must signal at least 100 feet before making a turn.

questions.question: When making a left turn from a two-way street onto another two-way street, you should turn into the left lane.
questions.explanation: When turning left, you should turn into the lane closest to the centerline (left lane).

questions.question: You may pass on the right when the vehicle ahead is making a left turn.
questions.explanation: You may pass on the right when the vehicle ahead is making or preparing to make a left turn.

questions.question: You must not pass another vehicle within how many feet of a bridge, viaduct, or tunnel?
questions.explanation: You cannot pass within 100 feet of a bridge, viaduct, or tunnel.

questions.question: In Arkansas, it is illegal for all drivers to text while driving.
questions.explanation: Arkansas law prohibits all drivers from texting while operating a vehicle.

questions.question: What is the minimum age at which a driver can use a handheld cell phone while driving?
questions.explanation: Arkansas law prohibits texting for all drivers. Drivers under 18 cannot use handheld devices at all while driving.

questions.question: You should always drive at the posted speed limit regardless of weather conditions.
questions.explanation: You must adjust your speed for weather, road, and traffic conditions. The speed limit is for ideal conditions only.

questions.question: What is the speed limit in a school zone when children are present?
questions.explanation: The speed limit in school zones is 25 mph when children are present or during posted hours.

questions.question: What is the minimum safe following distance under normal conditions?
questions.explanation: The minimum safe following distance is 3 seconds under normal conditions. Increase this in poor conditions.

questions.question: You should use high beam headlights in fog for better visibility.
questions.explanation: In fog, use low beams. High beams reflect off the fog and reduce visibility.

questions.question: When driving in rain, you should reduce your speed by:
questions.explanation: In rain, reduce your speed by at least one-third. In heavy rain or on wet roads, reduce even more.

questions.question: Bicyclists have the same rights and responsibilities as motor vehicle drivers.
questions.explanation: Bicyclists must follow the same traffic laws as motor vehicles and have the same road rights.

questions.question: How much space should you give when passing a bicyclist?
questions.explanation: Arkansas law requires drivers to give at least 3 feet of clearance when passing a bicyclist.

questions.question: Motorcycles are entitled to use a full lane of traffic.
questions.explanation: Motorcycles have the same rights as other vehicles and are entitled to a full lane. Do not share lanes with motorcycles.

questions.question: Why should you increase following distance when behind a motorcycle?
options: They are more likely to speed
questions.explanation: Motorcycles can stop more quickly than cars. Increase following distance to give yourself more reaction time.

questions.question: Large trucks have larger blind spots than passenger vehicles.
questions.explanation: Trucks have much larger blind spots (No-Zones) on all sides, especially on the right side and directly behind.

questions.question: When following a large truck, you should:
questions.explanation: Increase following distance behind large trucks to improve visibility and ensure you're not in their blind spot.

questions.question: Pedestrians always have the right of way at marked crosswalks.
questions.explanation: Drivers must yield to pedestrians in marked crosswalks.

questions.question: When must you stop for a pedestrian?
questions.explanation: You must yield to pedestrians at any crosswalk, whether marked or unmarked, and at intersections.

questions.question: You must be able to see clearly in both eyes to obtain a driver's license in Arkansas.
questions.explanation: You can drive with vision in one eye if your visual acuity meets the minimum standard.

questions.question: What is the minimum visual acuity required for an unrestricted license?
questions.explanation: You need at least 20/40 vision in at least one eye for an unrestricted license.

questions.question: The legal blood alcohol concentration (BAC) limit for drivers 21 and over is 0.08%.
questions.explanation: The legal limit for drivers 21 and over is 0.08% BAC. Any amount over this is illegal.

questions.question: What is the BAC limit for drivers under 21?
questions.explanation: Arkansas has a zero-tolerance policy. Drivers under 21 cannot have a BAC of 0.02% or higher.

questions.question: You can be charged with DWI for driving under the influence of prescription medications.
questions.explanation: DWI applies to any substance that impairs your ability to drive, including legal prescription drugs.

questions.question: Being awake for 18 hours impairs driving ability similar to having a BAC of:
questions.explanation: Being awake for 18 hours impairs driving similar to a BAC of 0.05%. After 24 hours, it's like 0.10%.

questions.question: If your vehicle breaks down on the highway, you should try to move it as far off the road as possible.
questions.explanation: Get your vehicle completely off the road if possible. If not, move as far to the right as you can.

questions.question: If your vehicle breaks down on a highway, you should:
questions.explanation: Move away from your vehicle and away from traffic. Stay behind barriers if available.

questions.question: If you have a tire blowout, you should brake hard immediately.
questions.explanation: Do not brake hard. Hold the steering wheel firmly, ease off the gas, and brake gently once under control.

questions.question: If your brakes fail, you should:
questions.explanation: Pump the brake pedal rapidly to build pressure. Then shift to a lower gear and use the parking brake gradually.

questions.question: If you are involved in a crash, you must stop immediately regardless of the severity.
questions.explanation: You must stop immediately at the scene of any crash, no matter how minor.

questions.question: After a crash with injuries, what should you do first?
questions.explanation: Call 911 immediately if there are injuries. Render aid if qualified, but do not move injured persons unless necessary.

questions.question: You must pull over to the right for emergency vehicles with lights and sirens.
questions.explanation: You must pull to the right side of the road and stop for emergency vehicles with lights and/or sirens.

questions.question: When stopped on the side of the road, emergency vehicles must:
options: Be given a full lane clearance if possible
questions.explanation: Move over law: If safe, move over a full lane when passing stopped emergency vehicles. If not possible, slow down significantly.

questions.question: During the skills test, you may hit the curb once without failing.
questions.explanation: Hitting the curb is an automatic failure on the skills test.

questions.question: During the skills test, how many points result in automatic failure?
questions.explanation: Accumulating 25 or more points during the skills test results in automatic failure.

questions.question: At what age do passengers become responsible for their own seat belt use?
questions.explanation: Passengers 15 years and older are responsible for their own seat belt use. The driver is responsible for passengers under 15.

questions.question: What does a green arrow mean?
options: Protected turn in direction of arrow
questions.explanation: A green arrow means you have a protected turn and oncoming traffic must stop.

questions.question: Diamond-shaped signs are typically warning signs.
questions.explanation: Diamond-shaped signs warn of hazards ahead such as curves, merges, or other dangerous conditions.

questions.question: How far from railroad tracks must you stop?
questions.explanation: You must stop between 15 and 50 feet from the nearest rail when signals are active or a train is approaching.

questions.question: At an intersection with no signs or signals, you must yield to traffic already in the intersection.
questions.explanation: Always yield to vehicles already in the intersection, and to vehicles on your right if you arrive simultaneously.

questions.question: When must you use headlights?
options: 30 minutes after sunset to 30 minutes before sunrise
questions.explanation: Headlights must be used from 30 minutes after sunset to 30 minutes before sunrise, and whenever visibility is less than 500 feet.

questions.question: You should dim your high beams within 500 feet of an oncoming vehicle.
questions.explanation: Dim high beams within 500 feet of oncoming traffic and within 200 feet when following another vehicle.

questions.question: What should you do if your vehicle begins to hydroplane?
questions.explanation: If hydroplaning, ease off the gas and steer straight. Do not brake or turn suddenly.

questions.question: When your vehicle starts to skid, you should steer in the direction you want to go.
questions.explanation: Steer in the direction you want the front of the vehicle to go. This helps straighten the vehicle.

questions.question: Farm equipment and slow-moving vehicles must display an orange triangle on the rear.
questions.explanation: Vehicles traveling less than 25 mph must display a slow-moving vehicle (SMV) emblem - an orange triangle with red border.

questions.question: If you are taking medication, you should:
options: Ask your doctor about driving safety
questions.explanation: Always ask your doctor or pharmacist if medication may affect your ability to drive safely.

questions.question: Coffee and cold showers can help you sober up faster.
questions.explanation: Only time can eliminate alcohol from your system. Coffee and cold showers do not speed up the process.

questions.question: How long does it take for the average person to metabolize one standard drink?
questions.explanation: The body metabolizes approximately one standard drink per hour, though this varies by person.

questions.question: At what age can you obtain a learner's permit in Arkansas?
questions.explanation: You can obtain a learner's permit at age 14 in Arkansas.

questions.question: You must notify the Revenue Office within 30 days of a change of address.
questions.explanation: You must notify the Revenue Office within 30 days of any address change.

questions.question: What is the maximum speed limit on Arkansas interstate highways in rural areas?
questions.explanation: The maximum speed limit on interstate highways in rural areas is 70 mph unless otherwise posted.

questions.question: The speed limit in a residential area is typically 25 mph unless otherwise posted.
questions.explanation: The default speed limit in residential areas is 25 mph unless signs indicate otherwise.

questions.question: When entering a roundabout, you must yield to:
questions.explanation: Always yield to traffic already in the roundabout. Enter when there is a safe gap.

questions.question: You should use your turn signal when exiting a roundabout.
questions.explanation: Signal your right turn as you approach your exit from the roundabout.

questions.question: When backing up, you should rely primarily on your mirrors.
questions.explanation: Turn and look over your shoulder when backing up. Mirrors have blind spots and don't show everything.

questions.question: The area around your vehicle that you cannot see is called:
questions.explanation: Blind spots are areas around your vehicle that you cannot see in mirrors. Always check them before changing lanes.

questions.question: If another driver is aggressive or threatening, you should avoid eye contact and get out of their way.
questions.explanation: Do not engage with aggressive drivers. Avoid eye contact, let them pass, and report them if necessary.

questions.question: If an animal appears in front of your vehicle, you should:
options: Brake firmly and stay in your lane
questions.explanation: Brake firmly but stay in your lane. Swerving to avoid animals can cause loss of control or collision with other vehicles.

questions.question: If your steering fails, you should use your brakes to slow down quickly.
questions.explanation: If steering fails, take your foot off the gas and brake gently. Turn on hazard lights and coast to a safe stop.

questions.question: If your accelerator gets stuck, you should:
options: All of the above in order
questions.explanation: Shift to neutral immediately, brake to slow down, and get off the road. Do not turn off ignition while moving.

questions.question: During the parallel parking test, you must park within 18 inches of the curb.
questions.explanation: You must park within 18 inches of the curb and between the markers during the parallel parking portion.

questions.question: What is the minimum liability insurance required in Arkansas?
questions.explanation: Minimum liability coverage: $25,000 bodily injury per person, $50,000 per accident, $25,000 property damage.

questions.question: You must show proof of insurance when requested by law enforcement.
questions.explanation: You must carry proof of insurance and present it when requested by law enforcement.

questions.question: Drivers with a learner's permit must be accompanied by a licensed driver who is at least:
questions.explanation: A learner's permit holder must be accompanied by a licensed driver who is at least 21 years old.

questions.question: Drivers with an intermediate license cannot drive between midnight and 4 a.m. unless for work or emergencies.
questions.explanation: Intermediate license holders face curfew restrictions (11 p.m.-4 a.m. first 6 months, then midnight-4 a.m.) except for work, school, or emergencies.

questions.question: When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, you should:
options: Stop and wait for an opening
Speed up to match traffic speed
questions.explanation: Use the acceleration lane to speed up and match the speed of highway traffic before merging.

questions.question: When exiting a highway, you should slow down before entering the exit ramp.
questions.explanation: Wait until you are in the exit ramp's deceleration lane before slowing down. Maintain highway speed until then.

questions.question: How often should you check your mirrors while driving?
questions.explanation: Check your mirrors every 5-8 seconds to maintain awareness of traffic around you.

questions.question: You should look at least 10-15 seconds ahead while driving.
questions.explanation: Maintain a visual lead of 10-15 seconds ahead to identify hazards early and plan your response.

questions.question: You should not pass or interrupt a funeral procession.
questions.explanation: It is illegal to pass through, interrupt, or interfere with a funeral procession.

questions.question: If you are upset or emotional, you should:
questions.explanation: Strong emotions impair judgment and reaction time. Wait until you are calm before driving.

questions.question: If you witness a crash, you should:
options: Stop only if it looks serious
Post about it on social media
questions.explanation: Stop and offer assistance if safe to do so. Call 911 if needed and provide aid if qualified.

questions.question: If your vehicle catches fire, you should try to drive it to a service station.
questions.explanation: Stop immediately, turn off the engine, and get everyone out. Move away from the vehicle and call 911.

questions.question: How many points will result in license suspension for drivers under 18?
questions.explanation: Drivers under 18 face license suspension at 14 points in a three-year period.

questions.question: A conviction for reckless driving adds 8 points to your driving record.
questions.explanation: Reckless driving is an 8-point violation, one of the most serious on your record.

questions.question: U-turns are legal unless prohibited by signs.
questions.explanation: U-turns are allowed unless signs prohibit them or they cannot be made safely.

questions.question: Before changing lanes, you should:
options: Check mirrors, signal, check blind spot
questions.explanation: Check mirrors, signal your intention, check your blind spot, then change lanes when safe.

questions.question: Your tires must have at least 2/32 inch of tread depth.
questions.explanation: The minimum legal tread depth is 2/32 inch. Replace tires that are worn below this level.

questions.question: How often should you check your tire pressure?
questions.explanation: Check tire pressure at least monthly and before long trips. Proper pressure improves safety and fuel economy.

questions.question: You should merge as late as possible when a lane closes due to construction.
questions.explanation: Merge early when you see signs that a lane is ending. Late merging creates traffic congestion and unsafe situations.

questions.question: Early symptoms of carbon monoxide poisoning include:
questions.explanation: Early CO poisoning symptoms include headache, drowsiness, and nausea. Get fresh air immediately if you experience these.

questions.question: At 55 mph, it takes approximately 6 seconds or more than 400 feet to stop your vehicle.
questions.explanation: Total stopping distance includes reaction time and braking distance. At 55 mph, it takes over 400 feet to stop.

questions.question: The safest way to use a cell phone while driving is to:
questions.explanation: The only truly safe option is to pull over and stop before using your phone. Distraction is dangerous at any speed.

questions.question: The Move Over Law requires you to change lanes or slow down when approaching stopped emergency vehicles.
questions.explanation: Arkansas law requires drivers to move over a lane if safe, or slow down significantly when passing stopped emergency vehicles.

questions.question: If a traffic signal is not working, you should treat the intersection as:
options: No control - first come first served
questions.explanation: Treat a non-functioning traffic signal as a four-way stop. Stop and yield to traffic already in the intersection.

questions.question: When parking on a hill with a curb, you should turn your wheels toward the curb when facing downhill.
questions.explanation: Facing downhill, turn wheels toward the curb. Facing uphill, turn wheels away from the curb. This prevents the vehicle from rolling into traffic.

questions.question: On icy roads, you should increase your following distance to:
questions.explanation: On ice or snow, increase following distance to 8-10 seconds or more. Stopping distances are much longer on slippery surfaces.

questions.question: You may pass a school bus when its yellow lights are flashing.
questions.explanation: Flashing yellow lights mean the bus is preparing to stop. Slow down and prepare to stop. Do not pass.

questions.question: Which over-the-counter medication can impair driving?
questions.explanation: Antihistamines (allergy medications) can cause drowsiness and impair driving. Check labels for warnings.

questions.question: If your headlights suddenly go out at night, you should use your parking lights and emergency flashers.
questions.explanation: Turn on parking lights, emergency flashers, and try to get off the road safely. Check for blown fuses or loose connections.

questions.question: Refusing a chemical test when suspected of DWI results in:
questions.explanation: Arkansas has an implied consent law. Refusing a chemical test results in automatic license suspension.

questions.question: You must stop and remain stopped for pedestrians in a crosswalk until they have completely crossed your lane.
questions.explanation: Remain stopped until pedestrians have crossed your lane of travel. Do not proceed until they are clear of your path.

questions.question: You may not pass another vehicle when you are within how many feet of an intersection?
questions.explanation: Do not pass within 100 feet of an intersection, railroad crossing, bridge, viaduct, or tunnel.

questions.question: You should shift gears while crossing railroad tracks.
questions.explanation: Never shift gears while crossing railroad tracks. Your vehicle might stall. Cross in the gear you're already in.

questions.question: A pedestrian using a white cane or guide dog indicates they are:
questions.explanation: A white cane or guide dog indicates the person is blind or visually impaired. Always yield and give them space.

questions.question: Drivers can request hand controls or other adaptive equipment restrictions on their license.
questions.explanation: The Revenue Office can add restrictions to licenses requiring adaptive equipment for drivers with physical limitations.

questions.question: The most common cause of skidding is:
questions.explanation: Driver error (speed too fast for conditions, sudden braking or turning) is the most common cause of skidding.

questions.question: Before the skills test begins, the examiner will check your vehicle's lights, horn, and signals.
questions.explanation: The examiner performs a vehicle safety check before the skills test, checking all lights, signals, horn, brakes, and tires.

questions.question: A first DWI conviction results in a license suspension of:
questions.explanation: A first DWI conviction results in a 6-month license suspension, along with fines and possible jail time.

questions.question: A double solid yellow line means passing is prohibited in both directions.
questions.explanation: Double solid yellow lines mean no passing in either direction. These mark areas where passing is especially dangerous.

questions.question: When approaching a curve, you should:
questions.explanation: Slow down before entering a curve. Adjust your speed so you don't need to brake in the curve itself.

questions.question: Using your sun visor and sunglasses can help reduce sun glare while driving.
questions.explanation: Use your sun visor and polarized sunglasses to reduce glare. Slow down and increase following distance when glare affects visibility.

questions.question: When you see an emergency vehicle approaching from behind with lights and sirens, you should:
options: Pull to the right and stop
questions.explanation: Pull to the right side of the road and stop. Stay stopped until the emergency vehicle has passed.
